nodes.label: Computer abstraction and technology
nodes.title: Computer abstraction and technology:

nodes.label: Instruction set architecture
nodes.title: Instruction set architecture: Exploring the interface between hardware and software, defining the machine language instructions understood by the CPU.

nodes.label: High level language
nodes.title: High level language: Introducing programming languages like Python, Java, and C++, which offer higher levels of abstraction and productivity compared to assembly language.

nodes.label: Instructions: Language of the Computer
nodes.title: Instructions: Language of the Computer:

nodes.label: Logic design
nodes.title: Logic design: The process of designing digital circuits using logic gates to perform specific functions.

nodes.label: Logic operation
nodes.title: Logic operation: The manipulation of binary values using logical operators such as AND, OR, and NOT.

nodes.label: Logic gates
nodes.title: Logic gates: Electronic circuits that perform basic logical operations on one or more binary inputs to produce a single binary output, including AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, and XOR gates.

nodes.label: Arithmetic for Computers
nodes.title: Arithmetic for Computers:

nodes.label: Operation on integer
nodes.title: Operation on integer: Basic arithmetic operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division performed on whole numbers.

nodes.label: Addition and subtraction
nodes.title: Addition and subtraction: Adding or subtracting integers to perform mathematical operations.

nodes.label: Processor
nodes.title: Processor:

nodes.label: CPU performance factors
nodes.title: CPU performance factors: CPU performance factors: Various aspects affecting the performance of a CPU, including clock speed, instruction count, and CPI (cycles per instruction).

nodes.label: Instruction count
nodes.title: Instruction count: Instruction count: The total number of instructions executed by a program, influencing the overall execution time.

nodes.title: Advanced Compiler Structure:

nodes.label: Back end
nodes.title: Back end:

nodes.label: Instruction selector:
nodes.title: Instruction selector:: Instruction selector: Selects the instructions from the instruction set architecture (ISA) that best match the intermediate code.

nodes.label: Instruction scheduler：
nodes.title: Instruction scheduler：: Instruction scheduler: Reorders instructions to optimize execution time or resource utilization on the target architecture.

nodes.label: Code Generation
nodes.title: Code Generation:

nodes.label: Taxonomy of Target Languages
nodes.title: Taxonomy of Target Languages:

nodes.label: Machine assembly
nodes.title: Machine assembly: Machine assembly, a low-level target language, directly maps to machine instructions and is architecture-specific.

nodes.label: Higher level language
nodes.title: Higher level language: Higher-level languages like C, Java, or Python abstract away machine-specific details, allowing for platform-independent development.

nodes.label: The CiviC Virtual Machine
nodes.title: The CiviC Virtual Machine: The CiviC Virtual Machine is an example of a stack-based virtual machine designed for simplicity and ease of implementation.

nodes.label: Arithmetic Operations
nodes.title: Arithmetic Operations: Arithmetic operations in code generation encompass addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, among others.

nodes.label: Relational Operations
nodes.title: Relational Operations: Relational operations include comparisons like equality, inequality, greater than, less than, etc.

nodes.label: Logical Operations
nodes.title: Logical Operations: Logical operations involve Boolean operations such as AND, OR, and NOT.

nodes.label: Code Generation
nodes.title: Code Generation:

nodes.label: Instruction Selection
nodes.title: Instruction Selection: Instruction Selection: Selection of appropriate machine instructions to implement high-level language constructs.
